member.name: M:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.FindWindow(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the top-level window whose class name and window name match the specified strings. This function does not search child windows. This function does not perform a case-sensitive search.
member.param: If lpClassName is null, it finds any window whose title matches the lpWindowName parameter.
The window name (the window's title). If this parameter is null, all window names match.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the window that has the specified class name and window name.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.HWND_BROADCAST
member.summary: Handle used to send the message to all windows

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.WM_COPYDATA
member.summary: An application sends the WM_COPYDATA message to pass data to another application.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.COPYDATASTRUCT.dwData
member.summary: User defined data to be passed to the receiving application.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.COPYDATASTRUCT.cbData
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the data pointed to by the lpData member.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.COPYDATASTRUCT.lpData
member.summary: The data to be passed to the receiving application. This member can be IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: T:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.COPYDATASTRUCT
member.summary: Contains data to be passed to another application by the WM_COPYDATA message.

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows.
member.param: A handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message. If this parameter is HWND_BROADCAST ((HWND)0xffff), the message is sent to all top-level windows in the system.
The message to be sent.
Additional message-specific information.
Additional message-specific information.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.MessageFilterInfo.None
member.summary: Certain messages whose value is smaller than WM_USER are required to pass through the filter, regardless of the filter setting. There will be no effect when you attempt to use this function to allow or block such messages.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.MessageFilterInfo.AlreadyAllowed
member.summary: The message has already been allowed by this window's message filter, and the function thus succeeded with no change to the window's message filter. Applies to MSGFLT_ALLOW.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.MessageFilterInfo.AlreadyDisAllowed
member.summary: The message has already been blocked by this window's message filter, and the function thus succeeded with no change to the window's message filter. Applies to MSGFLT_DISALLOW.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.MessageFilterInfo.AllowedHigher
member.summary: The message is allowed at a scope higher than the window. Applies to MSGFLT_DISALLOW.

member.name: T:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.MessageFilterInfo
member.summary: Values used in the struct CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterExAction.Reset
member.summary: Resets the window message filter for hWnd to the default. Any message allowed globally or process-wide will get through, but any message not included in those two categories, and which comes from a lower privileged process, will be blocked.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterExAction.Allow
member.summary: Allows the message through the filter. This enables the message to be received by hWnd, regardless of the source of the message, even it comes from a lower privileged process.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterExAction.DisAllow
member.summary: Blocks the message to be delivered to hWnd if it comes from a lower privileged process, unless the message is allowed process-wide by using the ChangeWindowMessageFilter function or globally.

member.name: T:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterExAction
member.summary: Values used by ChangeWindowMessageFilterEx

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT.size
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes. Must be set to sizeof(CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT), otherwise the function fails with ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT.info
member.summary: If the function succeeds, this field contains one of the following values,

member.name: T:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT
member.summary: Contains extended result information obtained by calling the ChangeWindowMessageFilterEx function.

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterEx(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.ChangeWindowMessageFilterExAction,SkinToolDS.NativeMethods.CHANGEFILTERSTRUCT@)
member.summary: Modifies the User Interface Privilege Isolation (UIPI) message filter for a specified window
member.param: A handle to the window whose UIPI message filter is to be modified.
The message that the message filter allows through or blocks.
The action to be performed, and can take one of the following values
Optional pointer to a structure.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, it returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: F:SkinToolDS.IniFile.MaxSectionSize
member.summary: The maximum size of a section in an ini file.
member.remarks: This property defines the maximum size of the buffers used to retreive data from an ini file. This value is the maximum allowed by the win32 functions GetPrivateProfileSectionNames() or GetPrivateProfileString().

member.name: T:SkinToolDS.IniFile.NativeMethods
member.summary: A static class that provides the win32 P/Invoke signatures used by this class.
member.remarks: Note: In each of the declarations below, we explicitly set CharSet to Auto. By default in C#, CharSet is set to Ansi, which reduces performance on windows 2000 and above due to needing to convert strings from Unicode (the native format for all .Net strings) to Ansi before marshalling. Using Auto lets the marshaller select the Unicode version of these functions when available.

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.IniFile.GetSectionValuesAsList(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all of the values in a section as a list.
member.param: Name of the section to retrieve values from.
member.returns: A containing objects that describe this section. Use this verison if a section may contain multiple items with the same key value. If you know that a section cannot contain multiple values with the same key name or you don't care about the duplicates, use the more convenient function.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in VB)

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.IniFile.GetSectionValues(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all of the values in a section as a dictionary.
member.param: Name of the section to retrieve values from.
member.returns: A containing the key/value pairs found in this section.
member.remarks: If a section contains more than one key with the same name, this function only returns the first instance. If you need to get all key/value pairs within a section even when keys have the same name, use .
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in VB)

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.IniFile.GetKeyNames(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of all keys under a specific section in the ini file.
member.param: The name of the section to read key names from.
member.remarks: The total length of all key names in the section must be less than 32KB in length.
member.exception: is a null reference (Nothing in VB)

member.name: M:SkinToolDS.IniFile.GetSectionNames
member.summary: Gets the names of all sections in the ini file.
member.remarks: The total length of all section names in the section must be less than 32KB in length.
